title: What are the differences between magical and psychic phenomena, and what role does tradition play in magic?
first_phrase: This text examines the relationship between magical and psychic phenomena. The author argues that the intentionality and continuity of magical phenomena, as well as the active presence of superconsciousness, distinguishes it from spontaneous psychic phenomena. The author also emphasizes the importance of individual or group initiations and magical disciplines as the best way to heal a medium and encourage true spiritual development. Finally, the precision and discipline of magical methods are contrasted with the arbitrary nature of psychic phenomena. Overall, the text emphasizes the importance of intentionality and discipline in the practice of magic.

last_phrase: In conclusion, discipline and initiation are the most effective means of becoming a successful medium or achieving ascension through magic. Unlike the sporadic and spontaneous phenomena studied by metapsychics, magical traditions are developed through careful observation and adherence to a specific methodology, reinforced over time through a chain of knowledgeable practitioners. Any person seeking to engage in magical practices must have a direct or indirect connection to this tradition, and perform their rituals in a setting free from outside disruptions, which is what makes magic a powerful tool for those who utilize it correctly.
